content.description: Turkish Delight climbs jugs for days. The topout is the crux.
content.protection: 2 pads. It has a good landing area.
content.location: Stand start on the far right side of the face with your left hand on a triangle pinch and your right hand on any nearby jug. Follow the initial crack line up and left, avoiding the extra 6 feet of vertical climbing out right.

content.description: Sustained tech and manteling leads to some desperate floating to gain the high horizontal crack and some good footing. Undercling with nerves of steel to finish this classy highball.
content.location: Stand start in the middle of the blank slab face (about five feet left of Turkish Delight) with your right hand on a high pinch and your left hand crimping just below. Establish and mantel out right. Fancy footwork and a balancy left hand hold will get you to the high crack.

content.description: Cair Paravel Wall is a tall, steep, west-facing slab. This is your welcome image as you pull up to Cavern Rock Park.
